level.text: A preliminary investigation shall entail an inquiry by the Director to determine whether there is reasonable cause to believe that a violation has occurred.
Preliminary investigations may be initiated by any one (1) of the following means:
Referral by the Board of Elections;
Complaint by any employee or resident of the District of Columbia; or
A preliminary investigation conducted by OCF shall be strictly investigatory, non-adversarial, and non-adjudicatory.
Within thirty (30) days of initiation of a preliminary investigation, the Director shall determine whether a full investigation is necessary.
Within ten (10) days after initiation of a preliminary investigation, the Director shall notify, in writing, the person (respondent) who is the subject of the preliminary investigation.
Notification to the respondent shall consist of the following:
Explanation of the existence of the investigation and the general nature of the alleged violation; and
An offer to the subject affording the opportunity to respond to the allegation(s).
